intro: Sphaeromeria potentilloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its spherical, clustered flower heads are a distinguishing feature, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Sphaeromeria potentilloides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its drought tolerance and unique appearance.
